notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: 1. Det Blaakors (The Blue Cross) Christian Temperance Society. Meetings every first and third Monday of the month at 8:00 P.M. in the Grand Hall of the Danish Home for Youths, 615 N. Claremont Ave. New members accepted at every meeting.
2. Lodge Leif Erikson, #182 D.N.G.T.O. Meetings every Thursday evening at 8:00 o'clock in Dawes Hall, 915-917 W. North Ave. New members accepted every meeting.
3. Norona, Lodge #11, I.O.G.T. Meeting every Friday at 8:00 P.M., 917 W. North Ave. (opposite Humboldt Park.)
4. Tordenskjold, Lodge #20, I.O.G.T. Meetings every Thursday, 8:00 P.M., at Bowes Hall, corner Noble and W. Erie Streets.
5. Kamp og Seier (Struggle and Victory), Lodge #23, I.O.G.T. Meetings every Sunday evening at 8:00 o'clock, 917 W. North Avenue (opposite Humboldt Park).
6. Henrik Ibsen, Lodge $27, I.O.G.T. Meeting every Sunday at 6:30 P.M., in Flynn's Hall, 461 W. North Ave.

7. The Norwegian District Lodge of Illinois Scandinavian Great Lodge of the I.O.G.T. The Chicago office gives information concerning the work as well as regard the organization of new lodges throughout the state.
